articles.author: Robin George Andrews
articles.title: A 3D Encounter With a Violent Volcano’s Underbelly
articles.description: Scientists spent days aboard a helicopter with special sensors over a volcano to develop a picture of how its insides affect its frequent eruptions.
articles.content:
Réunion, a French island in the western Indian Ocean, is a jigsaw of two massive shield volcanoes. The younger, Piton de la Fournaise or peak of the furnace, is a furious factory of lava, erupting every eight months on average over the last four decades.
